titles: The taylor's wanton wife of Wapping: or, A hue-and-cry after a lac'd petticoat, flowr'd gown, and rich cornet; with other apparel, which was lost in the chamber of love. To the tune of What shall I do to show her how much I love her. Licensed according to order.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, and J. Back.,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Here I will give you a perfect relation ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
